intro: Commersonia echinata, commonly known as the spiny commersonia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its woody shrub structure. The plant features small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface and produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, smooth seeds. Commersonia echinata is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions.
